content:
yeah that crash is a shutdown hang. So I think the shutdown is not occurring so you get a crash when you attempt to revive it.

Perhaps check the task manager to see if Thunderbird is already running ( as a process, not necessarily as an application) before you attempt to start it and confirm.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The calendar has been an integrated part of Thunderbird for along time now. Since about version 68. So lightning the addon has been obsolete and not maintained for an equally long time.

The release version is 128, the beta is 138 Beta4 and daily, the developer build, claims to be 135. V130 is an abandoned Beta to the best of my knowledge. It is certainly not a supported build.

I have both the release and the daily builds installed and Alt+3 opens a calendar tab in both the versions I have installed. How does your experience differ?.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Very helpful. Alt+3 brought up the calendar and the "Events and Tasks" tab.

If that was documented somewhere, I never found it, obviously.

My frustration is over. Thank you so much.
creator: g_bechter

content:
Hi Sally,

Did you accidentally switch from table view to cards view?

Click the icon above your messages, on the far right. You will see options for table view and cards view.

Rick
creator: mozilla664

content: Click once to view in the reading pane. Double click to view in a tab or Windows. That has been that way since Thunderbird got tabs. So do I assume you are talking about having the message displayed in the reading pane?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: We know exactly what you tell us, so perhaps you could share the error message verbatim. unless you would like us to offer guesses as to what may be wrong. Or you could investigate why your mail is ending up with cloudmark. They sell phishing and spam management services after all https://www.cloudmark.com/en
creator: MattAuSupport

content: drag it to the location you want it to be a sub folder of. Say the account name if you want it on the same level as say inbox.
